page.title: 09BATTLEDYKES FARM : HISTORY
page.content: ON THE LAND OF WHAT IS NOW BATTLEDYKES FARM THERE WAS ONCE A{ {ROMAN CAMP}.IT WAS PROTECTED BY A DITCH AND A WALL WHICH SERVED IT WELL AGAINST ATTACK FROM NEARBY{PICTISH {VILLAGES.}THE LEGIONARIES DUG TRENCHES, OR DYKES,AROUND THE CAMP TO MAKE THE WALLS MORE DIFFICULT TO CLIMB. WHERE THE WALLS WERE, CAN ONLY BE SEEN IN JULY OR AUGUST AS THE CROPS GROW HIGHER WHERE THE SOIL HAS BEEN TURNED AND MIXED WHEN THE ROMANS FILLED THE TRENCHES WITH THE SOIL FROM THE WALL. THE FARMER HAS DISCOVERED SEVERAL ROMAN{GRINDING STONES}WHILE PLOUGHING HIS FIELDS.ON THE ORDNANCE SURVEY MAP A{TUMULUS}(BURIAL GROUND) IS MARKED SOUTH OF THE CAMP,WHERE URNS,SOME STILL CONTAINING THE ASHES OF THE DEAD, HAVE BEEN FOUND.
